Friends:

Despite paid sick days for rail workers not passing in the Senate this week, some good things are happening! In the South, where labor representation has been critically low, service workers have launched a new union based on antiracist principles. Also, a D.C. council member is gaining support for a bold new housing plan, a community in New York wins a historic rent reduction, Pennsylvanians score a victory against a notorious fracking company, and Los Angeles reckons with its long history of criminalizing street vending.

Read about all these historic victories in this week‚Äôs edition of You Love To See It below, a weekly feature reviewing good news, progress, and action steps.
